intro: Ruellia herzogii, commonly known as Herzog's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
